title: Introduction to DaVinci Resolve - [Full Course] for Beginners (2026)
relevance: Comprehensive 5-hour DaVinci Resolve course covering all 7 pages. Provides the foundational knowledge for every editing decision in the Rayviews pipeline: timeline assembly, Fairlight audio mixing with bus routing, Color Page node architecture, Fusion compositing for text overlays, and Deliver Page export settings including the H.265 + 4K upres trick for YouTube.
summary: Casey Faris (Blackmagic Certified Trainer, 554K subscribers) delivers a complete DaVinci Resolve 20 course covering Media Page (import, bins, metadata), Edit Page (insert modes, trim operations, Inspector properties, keyframe animation, Dynamic Zoom), Cut Page (dual-timeline rough assembly), Fusion Page (node compositing, Text+, Merge, masks, templates/macros), Color Page (YRGB Color Managed, node types, color wheels, curves, scopes, windows/qualifiers, gallery stills for batch grading), Fairlight Page (bus routing, EQ, Dialogue Compression preset, volume automation, Sound Library), and Deliver Page (H.265 Master + Ultra HD upres for YouTube, ProRes 422 HQ + Linear PCM archive, Render Queue batching). The course provides the conceptual model that maps directly to DaVinci Resolve's Python scripting API for pipeline automation.

key_insights.details: Export with H.265 Master preset at 3840x2160 (Ultra HD) instead of native 1080p. YouTube applies VP9/AV1 compression at higher quality for 4K uploads, resulting in noticeably better playback even though the source is 1080p.

Create dedicated Dialogue Bus, Music Bus, and SFX Bus, all routing to Bus 1 (main output). Apply shared effects per bus (compressor on Dialogue Bus affects all VO tracks). This replaces per-track processing with bus-level control.

key_insights.insight: Dialogue Compression preset as starting point
key_insights.details: Fairlight Dynamics panel has a built-in 'Dialogue Compression' preset in the dropdown. Low ratio, gentle threshold, small gain reduction + makeup gain. Good starting point for ElevenLabs TTS voiceover processing.

key_insights.insight: Dynamic Zoom + Paste Attributes for batch application
key_insights.details: Set Dynamic Zoom on one image clip, copy it, select all other image clips, Paste Attributes (Alt+V) with only Dynamic Zoom checked. Maps to API: loop over timeline items and set DynamicZoomEase property.

key_insights.insight: Power Bins persist across all projects
key_insights.details: Store rank badge templates, benefit callout templates, FTC disclosure text, standard SFX in Power Bins (Media Page > Master > Power Bins). Available in every project in the same Resolve database. Essential for pipeline template reuse.

key_insights.insight: Track Presets save full audio chains
key_insights.details: Save complete channel strip (EQ + compression + effects) as Track Preset. Load in new projects with one click. Save separate presets for VO, music, SFX, and Bus 1 master limiter.

Project Settings: Color Science = DaVinci YRGB Color Managed, Intermediate = HDR DaVinci Wide Gamut, Output = Rec 709. Resolve handles all internal color space conversions automatically. Upgrade from simple YRGB.

key_insights.insight: Timeline vs Clip nodes in Color Page
key_insights.details: Timeline nodes apply global grade to all clips (use for overall look). Clip nodes are per-clip (use for shot matching). Toggle between them with dots at top-right of node graph. Maps to pipeline: timeline node for brand look, clip nodes for product-specific corrections.

key_insights.insight: Archive export with separate audio tracks
key_insights.details: ProRes 422 HQ + Linear PCM 32-bit float + 'All Timeline Tracks' renders each Fairlight track as a separate audio stream. Preserves VO/music/SFX separation for future remixing or corrections.

key_insights.insight: Render Queue batching for multi-format delivery
key_insights.details: Stack YouTube (H.265 4K), archive (ProRes), and Shorts (9:16 via Smart Reframe) as separate render jobs. Render All processes entire queue sequentially. One-pass multi-format delivery.

Build node tree (Background + Text+ + Merge), select all, right-click > Macro > Create Macro, expose adjustable controls (text, colors, position), save to Templates folder. Access from Edit page Effects Library > Titles.

Select all clips for a product segment, right-click > New Compound Clip. Bundles into single timeline item. Double-click to edit contents. Useful for packaging the 90-second product segment as a reusable unit.

key_insights.insight: Gallery Stills for batch color grading
key_insights.details: Grade hero shot first, right-click viewer > Grab Still. Use split-screen compare against other clips. Right-click still > Apply Grade copies entire node tree. Middle mouse button click for quick copy between adjacent clips in thumbnail strip.

In Keyframe Editor curve mode: flatten Bezier handles = ease in/out (slow start/stop). Pointy handles = linear (mechanical). For Ken Burns zoom on product images, flatten handles for smooth, professional-looking motion.

key_insights.insight: Volume automation via Alt+Click control points
key_insights.details: Alt+click on clip volume line to add control points. Drag up/down to automate level changes. Ctrl+Alt+click to remove points. Use for fine-tuning music ducking points that AI tools miss.

key_insights.insight: Custom keyboard shortcuts for ripple trimming
key_insights.details: Casey maps Q = ripple trim start to playhead, W = ripple trim end to playhead, S = split at playhead. These three shortcuts handle 90% of editing operations and are faster than default Ctrl+Shift+[ / ] bindings.

tools_mentioned.name: DaVinci Resolve 20
tools_mentioned.note: Free version covers almost everything in the course. Studio required for H.265 on Windows, AI tools, and some effects.

tools_mentioned.name: Ground Control Courses
tools_mentioned.note: Casey's paid follow-up courses ($199 each): End-to-End filmmaking, Fusion 101-401, Color 101, Fairlight 101.

tools_mentioned.name: DaVinci Resolve Scripting API
tools_mentioned.note: Python/Lua API for automating project creation, media import, timeline assembly, render settings.

action_items.action: Test H.265 + 4K upres YouTube export and compare quality vs current H.264 1080p
Set up Fairlight bus routing template (Dialogue/Music/SFX buses → main)
Test 'Dialogue Compression' preset on ElevenLabs TTS output
Create Power Bins with rank badge, benefit callout, and FTC disclosure templates
Update resolve_editing_rules.md with H.265 export, bus routing, Color Managed workflow
Build Fusion macro templates for product name lower-third and rank badge overlay
Add archive export (ProRes 422 HQ + Linear PCM + separate tracks) to pipeline
Switch from simple YRGB to YRGB Color Managed + HDR Wide Gamut + Rec 709
Automate project creation with all Casey settings via Python API
Create DRP template timeline with pre-configured tracks, buses, and presets
Script 3-job Render Queue (YouTube + archive + Shorts) via API

steps: Test H.265 Master + Ultra HD upres on a completed video
Compare YouTube playback quality at 1080p vs 4K-upres at 1080p display
If quality improvement confirmed, update resolve_editing_rules.md Section 11
Add archive export job (ProRes 422 HQ) to standard render workflow
Create Fairlight bus layout: Dialogue Bus + Music Bus + SFX Bus → Bus 1
Apply 'Dialogue Compression' preset on Dialogue Bus
Test with existing ElevenLabs TTS chunks — measure LUFS before/after
Save as Track Preset for instant loading in new projects
Update resolve_editing_rules.md Section 6 with bus-based workflow
Create Power Bins with rank badge, benefit callout, disclosure text
Build Fusion macros for product name lower-third and rank badge overlay
Create DRP template project with all settings pre-configured
Script project creation with color management, track layout, bus routing
Script media import into organized bins
Script 3-job Render Queue setup (YouTube + archive + Shorts)

transcript_highlights.text: Click H.265 master and call it good... change resolution to Ultra HD
transcript_highlights.note: The 4K upres trick for YouTube — key export strategy change

transcript_highlights.text: We create a bus called Dialogue Bus... route all dialogue tracks to it
transcript_highlights.note: Bus-based audio architecture for shared processing

transcript_highlights.text: Turn on compressor, set threshold below average, low ratio... just a little bit of gain reduction
transcript_highlights.note: Dialogue Compression technique for consistent VO levels

transcript_highlights.text: DaVinci YRGB Color Managed... HDR DaVinci Wide Gamut... Rec 709 output
transcript_highlights.note: Recommended color science setup for Resolve 20

transcript_highlights.text: Every Fusion composition starts with MediaIn and ends with MediaOut
Inspector has Transform, Cropping, Composite... Dynamic Zoom toggle
transcript_highlights.note: Inspector properties for Ken Burns automation

transcript_highlights.text: The best way to learn Resolve: pick a project and just make it

analysis_meta.method: yt-dlp transcript extraction + web research + manual analysis
